TITLE: Artemis launch back on schedule after delays
SUMMARY: The debut flight of the uncrewed Space Launch System rocket is scheduled to lift off from Kennedy Space Center at 1:04 a.m. ET Wednesday

TITLE: FDA gives first safety sign-off for company selling lab-grown meat
SUMMARY: To sell its products to the public, Upside Foods still needs to get approval from the FDA and the Agriculture Department's Food Safety and Inspection Service

TITLE: Endangered status sought for manatees as hundreds starve
SUMMARY: Pollution is triggering algae blooms that have killed much of the seagrass on which manatees depend, conservations groups said

TITLE: China rocket taking 3 to space station to blast off Tuesday
SUMMARY: The station’s third and final module docked with the station this month, one of the last steps in China’s more than decadelong effort to maintain a constant crewed presence in orbit

TITLE: Catalonia limits water use as Spain prays for rain
SUMMARY: The measures taking effect Friday will include reductions on water for the irrigation of crops and industry

TITLE: World's largest active volcano, Mauna Loa, erupts in Hawaii
SUMMARY: It is the volcano's first eruption since 1984, the U.S. Geological Survey said. Officials said lava flows were "contained within the summit area and are not threatening downslope communities

TITLE: New space observatory helps solve mystery involving enormous black holes
SUMMARY: Some black holes unleash incredibly bright jets of high-energy particles. Researchers say they're starting to understand why

TITLE: Aerial video captures eruption of world's largest active volcano in Hawaii
SUMMARY: The video, captured by helicopter, shows the volcano spewing fountains of lava, which stretch across its surface, as clouds of smoke rise above

TITLE: Jargon alert: How doctors speak could cause 'harm' for patients
SUMMARY: "You could be the smartest doctor in the world, yet you're useless if your patients don't understand what you are saying," a University of Minnesota researcher said

TITLE: Hawaii locals fear the impact of the Mauna Loa eruption as lava oozes closer to a main highway
SUMMARY: As of Thursday afternoon, the lava was about 3.2 miles away from the Daniel K. Inouye Highway, also known as Saddle Road, which connects the east and west sides of the Big Island

TITLE: Wooden ship from 1800s uncovered on Florida beach after erosion caused by recent hurricanes
SUMMARY: The archeological team removed sand and made a shallow trench around the ’s wooden timbers, took measurements and made sketches to solve the 200-year mystery

TITLE: Going, going, extinct: Rare 76 million-year-old T. rex skull is up for auction
SUMMARY: The fossil could fetch up to $20 million, according to Sotheby’s, the auction house handling the sale

TITLE: Oldest DNA reveals life in Greenland 2 million years ago
SUMMARY: Today, it’s a barren Arctic desert, but back then it was a lush landscape of trees and vegetation with an array of animals, even the extinct mastodon

TITLE: Historic moon mission concludes with 'picture perfect splashdown' of Orion capsule into the Pacific
SUMMARY: Throughout its weekslong mission, the Orion capsule beamed back stunning photos and videos of the lunar surface

TITLE: Oil companies 'could doom global efforts' around climate change, House committee finds
SUMMARY: A report issued Friday by the House Oversight Committee said oil companies had “greenwashed” their public image while continuing to invest in fossil fuels

TITLE: Puerto Rico's shoreline changes after Hurricane Maria heighten coastal flooding risk
SUMMARY: “The migration of the coastline and beaches is an important issue that everyone has to urgently address,” geological oceanographer Maritza Barreto Orta said

TITLE: 'Firmageddon': Researchers find 1.1 million acres of dead trees in Oregon
SUMMARY: Oregon’s dead firs are a visceral example of how drought is reshaping landscapes in Western states that have been experiencing extreme heat conditions

TITLE: Scientists produce nuclear fusion breakthrough
SUMMARY: The Department of Energy is expected to announce tomorrow that researchers at the Lawrence Livermore National Lab in California have used lasers to produce a nuclear fusion reaction that creates energy. NBC News’ Tom Costello shares more about what scientists are calling the “Holy Grail” of clean energy

TITLE: We have 'ignition': Fusion breakthrough draws energy gain
SUMMARY: Researchers at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory achieved a crucial step in the pursuit of the elusive energy source, though it will not immediately open the floodgates to clean power in American homes

TITLE: Scientists declare Mauna Loa and Kilauea are 'no longer erupting'
SUMMARY: The U.S. Geological Survey’s Hawaiian Volcano Observatory will continue to monitor the volcanoes for signs of renewed activity

TITLE: 'Tripledemic' viruses still spreading. What the science shows about being contagious.
SUMMARY: How long do people remain infectious with respiratory viral diseases like Covid, flu and RSV

TITLE: Historic biodiversity agreement reached at U.N. conference
SUMMARY: "There has never been a conservation goal globally at this scale,“ said one observer

TITLE: A coal mine is on fire in Utah, leaving a small town at risk
SUMMARY: For residents near Lila Canyon, what happens next for the miners and the truck drivers who help deliver coal is up in the air

TITLE: At least 2 dead as 6.4-magnitude earthquake rocks Northern California
SUMMARY: A 72-year-old and an 83-year-old died when emergency responders couldn't get them adequate medical care in time, an official said

TITLE: What is a bomb cyclone?
SUMMARY: Such storms crop up at least once a year in the U.S., sometimes with devastating consequences

TITLE: Why can't some people smell months after catching Covid? Their immune response could be the answer
SUMMARY: Researchers found that people struggling to regain their sense of smell after Covid showed evidence of continued inflammation and an immune response that continued to persist after the virus was long gone

TITLE: NASA Mars lander InSight falls silent after 4 years
SUMMARY: The lander’s power levels have been dwindling for months because of all the dust coating its solar panels

TITLE: California woman convicted of murdering stepfather after she found nude photos of herself on his computer
SUMMARY: A San Diego County jury found Jade Sasha Janks guilty of first-degree murder in the slaying of butterfly conservationist Thomas Merriman
